message:
National Digital Library of India(NDLI) developed by IIT Kharagpur is focusing on forging collaborations with digital libraries in the US and Australia, as part of its second phase of development.Through collaborations, NDLI is looking at strengthening its own content, technology and business model,  poised to lead internationally on key areas related to Digital Libraries including digital rights.
Read more at:https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/industry/services/education/indias-digital-library-plans-to-collaborate-with-foreign-peers/articleshow/63371973.cms

IIT Kharagpur research scholar from the Department of Biotechnology  has developed a disposable and flexible battery made from paper that could generate power from the bacteria present in sewage water.The battery is made using air cathode, and the anode can be prepared from any simple carbon based materials.This  research presented by IIT Kharagpur's' Team Electrodes' at KPIT Sparkle 2018, won the first prize and a cash award of Rs 10 lakh competing with 12,000 students from across the country. For more details have a look into the following article.
https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/science/iitkgp-student-develops-paper-battery-from-bacteria-in-sewage/articleshow/63081738.cms

"When you brand yourself properly, the competition becomes irrelevant". 
The importance of branding is as important as the brand itself. 
Branding And Relations Cell since its inception has taken initiatives to position IIT Kharagpur as a global brand. We welcome you all to our introductory seminar, to get an insight into the working of the official public relations cell of IIT Kharagpur.

Also to make community outside IIT Kharagpur aware about the achievements of various students inside the campus, we will be launching the "Students' Speak" blog on the same day.

Date: 8th March
Time: 7:30 pm
Venue: V2, Vikramshila

IIT Kharagpur is set to host the two-day 'INAE Youth Conclave' from March 23, aiming to engage budding engineers from different disciplines. The main objective of the INAE is to provide a forum for our youth to manifest their budding talents and entrepreneurship zeal for improving the lives of common people.
Have a look at the following article published in Business Standard to know more regarding INAE Youth conclave.
http://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/iit-kgp-to-host-youth-conclave-for-budding-engineers-118030400109_1.html

Branding and Relations Cell, along with Technology Transfer Group , IIT Kharagpur, feels privileged to get an opportunity to organise the 2nd Edition of the INAE Youth Conclave here at IIT Kharagpur! Recently we had an overwhelming response from student groups and many requests to extend the deadline. To ensure healthy competition with strong submissions we decided to extend the deadline to 4th March 2018. We encourage participants to use this extension to their advantage. If you have already submitted and freezed your reports you can use this opportunity to refine it and resubmit it. 
Here is the link for an article published in Deccan Chronicle  regarding INAE
http://epaper.deccanchronicle.com/articledetailpage.aspx?id=10156678
The following are the important dates of INAE Conclave:
Declaration of shortlisted students to present their proposal at IIT Kharagpur:8th March 2018
Pre-conclave(Presentation of Proposal at IIT Kharagpur):23-25 March 2018
*7-8 teams will be shortlisted for  developing the existing solutions and solving new problems
Final Presentation:10-12 August,2018
Link for Submissions: http://www.inae2018.iitkgp.ac.in/login.php

A total of 74 offers were made to the batch of 51 students of the joint postgraduate diploma in business analytics (PGDBA) programme of IIT Kharagpur, IIM-C and ISI of Kolkata during the final placement process.The highest domestic offer of Rs. 41.4 lakh per annum while the highest international offer of Rs. 47.02 lakh per annum. BFSI and consulting sectors were among the biggest recruiters.

A total of 74 offers were made to the batch of 51 students of the joint postgraduate diploma in business analytics (PGDBA) programme of IIT Kharagpur, IIM-C and ISI of Kolkata during the final placement process.The highest domestic offer of Rs. 41.4 lakh per annum while the highest international offer of Rs. 47.02 lakh per annum. BFSI and consulting sectors were among the biggest recruiters.

IIT Kharagpur Law School The Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law (RGSOIPL) has started Legal Aid and an intellectual property (IP) facilitation cell recently to provide legal service to the needy and enable legal literacy.The Cell will help people from across the country to register for geographical indication (GI).The geographical indication (GI) is a unique case which is directly related not just to one artisan but to the communities that use local resources for the sustenance of livelihoods.The faculty and students of the school will run legal aid and IP facilitation camps on Saturdays in order to provide assistance to whoever may require it.For more information go through the below link.
http://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/iit-kgp-law-school-launches-legal-aid-and-ip-facilitation-cell-118021401306_1.html

IIT Kharagpur Law School The Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law (RGSOIPL) has started Legal Aid and an intellectual property (IP) facilitation cell recently to provide legal service to the needy and enable legal literacy.The Cell will help people from across the country to register for geographical indication (GI).The geographical indication (GI) is a unique case which is directly related not just to one artisan but to the communities that use local resources for the sustenance of livelihoods.The faculty and students of the school will run legal aid and IP facilitation camps on Saturdays in order to provide assistance to whoever may require it.For more information go through the below link.
http://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/iit-kgp-law-school-launches-legal-aid-and-ip-facilitation-cell-118021401306_1.html

IIT Kharagpur Law School The Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law (RGSOIPL) has started Legal Aid and an intellectual property (IP) facilitation cell recently to provide legal service to the needy and enable legal literacy.The Cell will help people from across the country to register for geographical indication (GI).The geographical indication (GI) is a unique case which is directly related not just to one artisan but to the communities that use local resources for the sustenance of livelihoods.The faculty and students of the school will run legal aid and IP facilitation camps on Saturdays in order to provide assistance to whoever may require it.For more information go through the below link.
http://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/iit-kgp-law-school-launches-legal-aid-and-ip-facilitation-cell-118021401306_1.html

The Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law (RGSOIPL) here, has started an intellectual property (IP) facilitation cell recently, to provide legal service to the needy and enable legal literacy. The faculty and students of the school will run legal aid and IP facilitation camps on Saturdays in order to provide assistance to whoever may require it, institute officials said. "Access to legal aid is still a problem in Indian society, especially in rural areas.

In many cases, a legal step is simple but people hesitate to take it," Professor Padmavati M, Dean of the IIT-Kharagpur Law School said. In many cases, good legal advice can lead to expedite solutions, she said. "Sometimes it is even necessary to avoid long legal wrangles and take immediate action," she said. In marital cases, too, timely legal advice may lead to early resolution, she said. "When we enable the mechanism of legal aid to the village sarpanch or panchayat leader - peoples' first level of contact with authority - the people are already enabled. This is the reason why the legal aid cells plan of spreading legal literacy is so important," she said. The cell will also provide assistance on cyber issues, assist in the protection of indigenous crafts and other areas where its expertise in intellectual property rights needed, she said. A significant activity of the cell would be to provide intellectual property rights (IPR) protection service, especially where its expertise is required in building a case for GI and registering it, she added. Geographical indication (GI) is a unique case which is directly related not just to one artisan but to the communities that use local resources for sustenance of livelihoods, the professor said. Apart from this, the law school has plans to create a group of paralegal volunteers who will work with the district legal services. Professor Padmavati hoped that the cell would eventually go online to provide legal assistance to a larger number of people. Justice Aniruddha Bose, Judge, Calcutta High Court and Executive Chairman, West Bengal Legal Services, inaugurated the cell earlier this month. The Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law (RGSOIPL) in IIT-Kharagpur is a unique law school that was set up in 2006 with the help of a distinguished alumnus Vinod Gupta to groom the scientists and engineers into intellectual property lawyers. The law school offers a three-year LLB program with specialisation in intellectual property law (IPL) recognised by the Bar Council of India, the LLM program in various disciplines of law and a doctoral program.

Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur will join hands with All India Institutes of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) to set up the coveted Dr B C Roy Institute of Medical Science & Research — the first medical hospital in an IIT, with an aim to offer medical courses in future.The hospital will start operations by 2018 end. The super speciality hospital will offer consultation in orthopaedic, cardiology and neuroscience.Dr B C Roy Institute of Medical Science & Research will open with a provision for 400 beds and will be a research-hospital spanning over 42 acres. The hospital will be administered by a registered society with its governing body headed by the director, IIT Kharagpur. The phase I of the project will cost about Rs 400 crore.It is expected that within 2021 IIT-KGP will apply to the Medical Council of India (MCI) to start admission of students, offering MBBS degree.

For more details go through the below link
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/iit-aiims-hospital-to-start-ops-by-year-end/articleshow/62828977.cms

Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur will join hands with All India Institutes of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) to set up the coveted Dr B C Roy Institute of Medical Science & Research — the first medical hospital in an IIT, with an aim to offer medical courses in future.The hospital will start operations by 2018 end. The super speciality hospital will offer consultation in orthopaedic, cardiology and neuroscience.Dr B C Roy Institute of Medical Science & Research will open with a provision for 400 beds and will be a research-hospital spanning over 42 acres. The hospital will be administered by a registered society with its governing body headed by the director, IIT Kharagpur. The phase I of the project will cost about Rs 400 crore.It is expected that within 2021 IIT-KGP will apply to the Medical Council of India (MCI) to start admission of students, offering MBBS degree.

For more details go through the below link
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/iit-aiims-hospital-to-start-ops-by-year-end/articleshow/62828977.cms

IIT Kharagpur has successfully conducted Young Innovators' program(YIP)2K17 which provided a platform for young innovators to showcase their innovative ideas to solve some of the crucial problems faced by the society.Some of them are Smart shoes for relief from arthritis, a device to allow freedom of movement to wheelchair users, a  device that can detect an oil slick and suck it out of the sea, alcohol detection system to shut down vehicular engines when drowsiness is detected in the eyes of the driver, a pushcart which is affordable to street vendors and functional in preserving fruits and vegetables under the sun,many more.To know more about these ideas have a look at the below link
https://www.telegraphindia.com/calcutta/ideas-for-tomorrow-182509

story: Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
YIP conducted its final round today.The last round -YIP Symposium saw the top 6 shortlisted teams illustrating their project models through powerpoint presentations. The finalists were questioned on the cost effectiveness of their projects and asked about a detailed energy consumption analysis of their models when applied to consumer domain. 
Team BARC is delighted to announce the winners of this year's first YIP. They are:
Winner: Laxmi School(Gomathi L,Muthu Aishwaryaa S, 
             Sahithiya Nirupen)
1st Runner-Up: Mother's Public School(Jaydev Sahoo,Atul 
                          Kumar Sahoo,Mrinal Das)
2nd Runner-Up: The Crossword School(Vijayaditya Reddy 
                           M,Sudhamsu G,Vishnu Teja Ch)
Here are some proud moments of today's valedictory ceremony.

story: Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos — with J van Talukder and 3 others.
message: The students of YIP were introduced to the working of Technology Robotix Society today at Kalidas Auditorium. The innovators were further introduced to the field of innovation as they learnt about basic robotic terminologies. After all, it's the motto of the institute to seek young innovators from all over the world and give them proper guidance and encouragement. Here are some glimpses of the event

story: Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 8 new photos — with Vikash Kumar Sharma and 3 others.
message:
Young innovators presented their project models today at IIT Kharagpur. It was amazing to see young, cheerful students giving such demonstrations. Indeed, it seemed as if YIP has unveiled the innovator in them. The presentation was conducted at Vikramshila in the afternoon. We could see students busy setting up their models trying their best to give the most effective and convincing demonstrations. Here are some glimpses of the event.
#IITKgp_YIP17
Join us Live for the YIP-Symposium.
Young Innovator's Programme (29/10/2017) Part-I-https://youtu.be/rXItbJq6pGw
Young Innovator's Programme (29/10/2017) Part-2-https://youtu.be/HCOa2LcjVfY

story: Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 5 new photos — with Simran Garg and Vaibhav Tomar.
message:
Young Innovators’ Program 2017 was inaugurated today at IIT Kharagpur.Our Honourable Associate Dean of Alumni Affairs and International Relations, Prof.Baidurya Bhattacharya inaugurated the first of its kind event today morning.Students from all over India have been looking forward to this event since it's first media intervention.24 school teams shortlisted for the last two rounds got the opportunity to visit the campus and be a part of the inauguration ceremony.Here are some glimpses of the event.
 #IITKgp_YIP17
The entire event can be accessed on youtube at-
https://youtu.be/Nobs7k37K9M

IIT Kharagpur is all set to launch Young Innovators' Programme.The event would be inaugurated tomorrow 28th October, 2017. 24 teams comprised of one of the most creative and innovative minds in the country are going to embrace this event.The final rounds are model presentation and YIP symposium.The students would be giving a detailed description of their technical models.All the students are equally excited about the event.And guess what;there would be youtube live streaming of the two rounds of the event .Here's the link for tomorrow's inauguration ceremony streaming.Just give it a click  to get to know of live updates of YIP.
#IITKgp_YIP17
https://youtu.be/Nobs7k37K9M
YIP has witnessed extensive media coverage since it's first round. Here's an overview of it.
http://indianexpress.com/article/education/iit-kharagpur-to-host-young-innovators-programme/

IIT Kharagpur gets all set for welcoming Young Innovators from various parts of India by organising Young Innovators' Programme(YIP)2K17 to nurture them as the future of India's scientific community, providing a chance to explore the scientific environment within the IIT campus and attend a workshop on Robotics.
To know more about the event give a read to  the following link

story: Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur shared IIT Kharagpur's post.
message: Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur shared IIT Kharagpur's post. 3 Days to go... Young Innovators’ Program is a platform to foster young minds with scientific enthusiasm and a credo to solve the problems facing the globe. IIT Kharagpur with a motive of recognizing students with creative ability to conduct scientific research has for the first time launched this program. In a two day visit to IIT Kharagpur, the students will get a chance to explore the scientific environment within and an opportunity to present their projects in front of distinguished researchers and guests

message: Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur shared IIT Kharagpur's post. 3 Days to go... Young Innovators’ Program is a platform to foster young minds with scientific enthusiasm and a credo to solve the problems facing the globe. IIT Kharagpur with a motive of recognizing students with creative ability to conduct scientific research has for the first time launched this program. In a two day visit to IIT Kharagpur, the students will get a chance to explore the scientific environment within and an opportunity to present their projects in front of distinguished researchers and guests

Here comes the most awaited celebration of IIT KGP,  illumination. All the Kgpian hearts have been eagerly throbbing for this festival of lights which unites the entire KGP family. Today, we would see thousands of diyas wiping off the darkness all around, the effort of every Kgpian being highlighted by the mighty chatais. It’s much more than a festival for us- the Kgpians. It symbolises the cultural variety, the linguistic differences of every fellow kgpian and the bonding that exists between them inspite of such differences. So, let's all come out together and celebrate Diwali in its true essence.

Thanks to Mayank Pratyush Kartik Saksham Goyal and Abhinav
for their contribution to the video.

story: Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is with Raúl Nàndi and 13 others at IIT Kharagpur.
message: Today, BARC got the opportunity to interact with Mr.Deepit Purkayastha, one of the 3 co-founders of Inshorts app. Yes, the so immensely popular apps’ leader was there to give tips on public relations. The cell members got a handful of marketing tips from him which they were at first unaware of. He was calm and talked very politely with us. Being an alumni of KGP, he was totally ready to enhance the glory of the institute. We were very lucky to have got the chance to talk to him. BARC wishes him success in all his future endeavours.
